channel.title: Internet Society Opportunities
channel.description: Latest opportunities to get involved with Internet Society initiatives

item.title: Endorse ISOC Analysis of WSIS+20 Rev. 1
item.description: In preparation for the WSIS+20 High-Level Meeting of the UN General Assembly (16-17 Dec), the Co-Facilitators of the WSIS+20 process United Nations is inviting contributions from all stakeholders to inform the process that follows the indicative roadmap shared by the WSIS+20 Co-Facilitators. It will guide the intergovernmental negotiations and the participation of other stakeholders.

item.title: Community Day Latin America and the Caribbean
item.description: This session will take a strategic look at how community-led efforts have transformed the Internet ecosystem in four key areas: Connectivity, Online safety, Technical Community, Accesibility and Public Policy.

item.title: Donate: Let's work together to build the Internet we want!
item.description: What sets the Internet Society apart is that we do more than advocate. We build. We defend the Internetâ€™s core infrastructure, expand access in real communities, and protect the technologies that keep it open and secure. Your donation supports that unique, hands-on work.

item.title: Join the Global Encryption Coalition
item.description:
Some governments and organizations are pushing to weaken encryption, which would create a dangerous precedent that compromises the security of billions of people worldwide. Actions in one country that undermine encryption threaten all of us.
With over 400 members distributed across 103 countries, the Global Encryption Coalition promotes and defends encryption in key countries and multilateral fora where it is under threat. It also supports efforts by companies to offer encrypted services to their users.

item.title: WSIS+20 Working Group
item.description: Join our WSIS+20 Working Group and help shape the future of our Internet vision and global policy. The WSIS+20 review is a key moment for digital development. Its outcomes will guide future UN action and stakeholder involvement.
